title: The search results of Thai language might be incomplete
content:
The search accuracy of Thai language in the Global Search and Service Portal requires further tuning. The sentence breaking issue may be the potential cause. You can refer to the following solution for improvement guidance, which uses NGram to split texts into tokens containing N characters. These procedures have achieved ideal outcomes in customer environments.

Before you start, make sure you've enabled DetectLanguageType=true parameter. For more information, see How to include DetectLanguageType=true parameter.

  1. Log in to the control plane node or bastion node as root or a sudo user.

  2. Run the following command to display all content files:
    kubectl get po -n <suite_namespace> | grep con-
    For example, kubectl get po -n itsma-1dmwm | grep con-

  3. Log in to the NFS server and add the NGram=2 under the [thai] section to all content config files:

    [thai]

    Encodings=UTF8:thaiUTF8

    SentenceBreaking=thaibreaking

    NGram=2

    Stoplist=thai.dat

    IndexNumbers=1

    HyphenChars=NONE

    AugmentSeparators=-_

    See the following table for the configuration file locations. Note that if the configuration file can't be found, manually add the folder and file.

    NAME Configuration file location
    smarta-saw-con-0 <config-volume>/idol/saw/content/smarta-saw-con-0/content.cfg
    smarta-sawarc-con-0 <config-volume>/idol/sawarc/content/smarta-sawarc-con-0/content.cfg
    smarta-sawmeta-con-0 <config-volume>/idol/sawmeta/content/smarta-sawmeta-con-0/content.cfg
  4. Restart all the pods using the kubectl delete pod <podname> -n <suite_namespace> command.
  5. Perform a full reindex to refresh it. See Perform a full reindex for Smart Analytics.
